name: basel.js
description:
basel.js = new Meetup("basel","javascript");

Its heating up. Browsers are getting mature with very good support for javascript. Application logic is moving into the browsers. Graphics support is now incredible with Canvas and WebGL. Javascript is making serious in-roads on the server with node.js - which now even Microsoft is supporting. And Adobe is changing its focus with the recent news of halting development of mobile Flash plugin and recent aquisition of PhoneGap.

Front end web technology, anchored by javascript is an excellent stack for cross platform development of applications, web, native and mobile. Microsoft has made public its plans to use HTML5 as the new platform for native Windows apps (ie Metro). Developers are discovering that this is a powerful language, not just for rollovers any more. But its very a different language then many of us are used to: Not a classic OOP class based language. A very func-y language. WTF are closures? What is a functional programming language? Better then standard OOP? More elegant? Or more risk prone?

Javascript is big now, but somewhat by accident, the default language of all browsers. What's going to happen now? Can it remain as is? There are many libraries that allow you to program in a classic OOP style. And companies are coming up with tools like GWT or Dart that allow you to generate javascript from other languages. Where is this all going?

Shall we geek-out?

(Note - sorry for writing this in English! Meetup in German.)

Recommended reading:

How LinkedIn used node.js and HTML to build a better app: http://venturebeat.com/2011/08/16/linkedin-node/

Recent episodes of Javascript Weekly: http://javascriptweekly.com/archive/ Looking forwards to it! Twitter @basel_js

name: Disruptive technologies in Planet Marseille !
description:
Nous sommes un groupe de hacker/maker enthousiastes.

Les nouvelles technologies informatiques et leurs impacts sur notre monde nous passionnent :

  • le cloud - amazon, heroku, ... cloud9, nitrous.io, coderio,...
  • le bigdata - hadoop & storm
  • les nouvelles architectures web& mobile - javascript (node.js), temps réel, NoSQL (redis, mongo, neo4j), webrtc
  • le monde merveilleux de l'électronique via les IoT - arduino & Raspberry

Nous nous réunissons régulièrement (1 fois par mois) pour échanger nos découvertes (bibliothèques, outils de dev, frameworks alternatifs, cloud paas node.js, …), nos compétences, les meilleurs pratiques du milieu (méthodes agiles, tests…), mais aussi pour discuter de l'écosystème sur la région (emploi, entrepreneuriat, social, action citoyenne, open data, etc…).

twitter : @Marseilledisrup

name: NodeSchool Silesia
description: Regularne spotkania NodeSchool na Śląsku! Jeśli chcesz poznać Node.js i napisać pierwszą aplikację - zapraszamy! Jeśli już znasz Node.js i chcesz podzielić się wiedzą - zapraszamy! Weźcie ze sobą laptopy! Szczegóły dot. samej organizacji znajdziecie na stronach: - http://nodeschool.io/silesia - http://nodeschool.io

name: Lagos Next Gen Developers Meetup
description:
!!!WE WILL DO WHATEVER WE WANT!!! 

.This meetup group focuses on application development, with emphasis on cloud, big data, analytics, mobile, social and security. It is geared towards developers and technologists who want to create great apps. To build the next generation of apps we must change: - How we scale apps - How we build and test - Where applications run - How apps communicate - Embrace new ways of thinking Even the definition of what makes an application has changed with Cloud, Mobile and Internet of Things. 

.

Our meetups give you the opportunity to get hands on with new and proven technologies to build applications designed for this new world of Cloud, Web, Mobile, Social and Internet of Things. Our Meetups typically include a 45-60 min (max) presentation to provide an introduction to technologies and techniques to help overcome the challenges of building next generation apps. This is usually followed by several hours of hands on experience working alongside fellow developers, and meeting with the developers behind the tools. There is often an opportunity to be among the first to experience alpha/beta technologies . We provide access to all the tools including in the cloud environment. Just bring your laptops. Of course, all our meetups are free to attend and no marketing or sales pitches are permitted. 

.

Plans for this Meetup include: - Building production-ready node.js, Java, ASP.net and Ruby using the Cloud - Creating applications and deploying in the Cloud using open platform-as-a-service technology IBM BlueMix - Wiring the Internet of Things to the Cloud using Node-Red, MQTT - Scaling Java applications using WAS Liberty 

.HIGHLIGHTS: 

+We will be writing codes/apps for Sensor Tags, Raspberry Pi, Parrot Drones etc. 

+We will build cognitive apps, that can think like human beings

+We will build apps that plug into social media and analyse data such as twitter feeds, etc. 

+We will compete in challenges and hackathons. 

+ WE WILL DO WHATEVER WE WANT!!!

name: NodeJS Athens Meetup
description: This meetup is focused on spreading knowledge and best practices for the use of Node.js. Topics of discussion include open source projects, architectures, testing, code management, the future of Node.js and emerging trends.

name: Abu Dhabi JavaScript Workshop
description:
Let’s get started with web programming using JavaScript. The event is conducted as programming workshop, pair programming or discussions where you come and learn to write a real code to solve a real world problem in a fun and engaging environment. The event is open and free for all programming levels and it will be centered on Node.js and JavaScript.

Our programming sessions will be conducted by professional software engineers who will go through the best practice in writing a good and maintainable code. Bring your own project, if you would like to know how it can be implemented with Node.js. 


Join , participate, and have fun !

name: Nairobi JavaScript Community
description:
Community/user group focused on HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript inclusive of Node.js and related web development topics. We meet up time to time, backed by an Email and event announcement on the 2nd Saturday of every month, 2 pm at iHub tech space.

Other channels we e-meetup all the time:

We have thriving online channels namely Slack, Telegram and WhatsApp channel/groups:

Slack: http://bit.ly/slack-nbi-js (self-invite)

Telegram: https://telegram.me/nairobijs (auto-invite and addition)

WhatsApp: get in touch with on Slack


Introduction

First of all, head over to Trippa, a speed typing testing application, and check/test it out. When satisfied with what you see, head over to it's repo -- http://github.com/kn9ts/trippa, study the files and file structure while at it. Then check out the project (link at the top of the repo).

It was done in 3 days. Is this possible? Yes. How?Using:

- JavaScript Framework

- LESS, a CSS preprocessor

- Pug(previously Jade), a HTML5/node.js templating engine

- Bower & NPM for efficient packages/libraries management

- Firebase, a cloud push service, database and static server deployment

- Gulp.js, a task automation tool

- Git & Github for version control and repo hosting respectively

- Jshint, a linting tool that automates syntax errors detection and reporting

- Static file handling

Now it's harder to believe it was done in 3 days.  And some of tools above seem like I've cooked up.

If some or all of the tools/workflow listed above were like "何とか何とか何とか..." to you, then you have all the reasons to join this community and be present in all meet-ups and understand how we are able to build complex applications MVPs in mere days or hours. And find out what the "fudge" all the above are.

We look forward to hearing from you, and to seeing you at an upcoming event. 

Get in touch at eugenemutai@gmail.com or holla at me on twitter: @kn9ts

organizer.name: Eugene Mutai
organizer.bio: Full-stack software engineer at @Andela | #GDE | #MEAN NINJA | @GoLang enthusiast | @NairobiJS community lead. Making things happen. Telling better stories.

name: New Zealand Parallel Computing Technology Meetup
description:
The current generation of computing technology is largely based on Wintel with a momentum generated by Moore's Law. The next generation will be very different and will be based on parallel & heterogeneous computing as against sequential & homogeneous. People who are interested in the development of this technology should join. You can be an end-user professional to benefit from the new technology, an engineer or technologist contributing to the development of technology, a computer scientist who sorts out algorithms, or an advocate who explains and promotes the benefits to the public (laymen). Largely this is a meet up group of professionals in New Zealand.

Our scope of interest include CPU, GPU, Many Core, FPGA, Linux, Windows, C/C++, functional programming, big data, high performance computing, OpenCL, CUDA, OpenMP, OpenMPI, single node, multiple node cluster, scientific research, industrial applications, radio astronomy (SKA is the project that gave birth to this meet up group), computer vision, image processing, audio video, ...

name: JS Frameworks & JavaScript.NEXT
description:
JS Frameworks and JavaScript.NEXT - New version of JavaScript 1.6 and 1.7 will be ruling over next couple of years.  Participate in the  meetup to understand and choose right MVC framework for your next project. Examine the internal Mechanics of Angular JS, Backbone JS, Ember JS, React JS, Can JS, Knockout JS and find unsolicited opinions of it. Discover why MEAN STACK instead of LAMP Stack, JAVA stack/.NET stack and understand full stack javascript.
Full stack JS:
MEAN STACK - Mongo, Express, Angular, Node
Client (MVC): Angular JS, Backbone JS
Client-server connectivity: Express JS
Server : Node JS (60,000+ modules)
Server DB connectivity: Mongoose
Database (document based): Mongo DB / Couch DB

name: Kochi NodeSchool Event
description:
NodeSchool Kochi 

If you want to increase your skills with Node, this is easily the best way to do it. 

We will be hosting hands-on workshops for beginners. 

Some Discussions on Node Js :

• Prefer many short talks vs. few long talks.

• Focus on cutting-edge technologies and development techniques.

• Focus on open source over commercial products.

• Focus on clean code.


If you want to help out, sponsor, or have any suggestions or feedback, just get in touch!

name: Build With Code - Los Angeles
description:
Build with Code hosts free weekly JavaScript and Software Engineering workshops, lectures and pair-programming sessions. Welcome!

Learn and build with the hard parts of JavaScript every Thursday 6:30pm-8:00pm through intuitive lectures and pair-programming

The reason people who only watch programming videos don't become programmers is because they're not programming. Come join other aspiring engineers and start building!

In JavaScript the Hard Parts, we cover callbacks, higher-order functions (functional programming with JavaScript), object-oriented programming with JavaScript, closure, scope and execution context

Hosted at Codesmith every week on Thursdays 6:30pm-8:00pm and taught by Codesmith CTO Will Sentance

Price: Always free

Codesmith (Codesmith) 

Codesmith teaches full stack software engineering in JavaScript through a 12 week immersive program. 

We teach computer science, object-oriented JavaScript, React, Angular, Node, distributed systems and mobile development so our grads can secure mid-to-senior level software engineering positions or launch their own ventures

Apply to the program at codesmith.io/apply. For further questions email admissions@codesmith.io

---

JavaScript the Hard Parts is a free workshop series in Los Angeles designed to teach pair programming and essential programming in JavaScript - including callbacks, higher order functions (like how to understand map, reduce, filter and foreach), closure, object-oriented programming in JavaScript and other topics

In Codesmith Information sessions, attendees meet with current students and graduates to discuss what it's like to attend Codesmith, what characteristics create the best coding bootcamp in Los Angeles, how to get into Codesmith and how to succeed in the Codesmith interview

next_event.name: Framework Info Session: Part-Time JavaScript Program (online)

name: London .NET User Group
description: Welcome to the London .NET user group. The group was established in 2002 to provide developers developers working with Microsoft's .NET framework with access to the latest and best information. At our monthly meetings you can hear expert speakers who dig 'under the hood' and keep you informed on best practices and future directions. We have long pushed beyond the boundaries of traditional MS education; we covered topics like TDD and NHibernate as early as 2004 and today we talk about Node.JS, NoSQL alongside more traditional topics

organizer.name: Ian Cooper
organizer.bio:
I run the London .NET user group. You can find our meeting page at http://www.dnug.org.uk

Feel free to come along, our events are free

name: Colombo JS Meetup
description: This group consist of enthusiastic JavaScript developers , we would talk about front end developments , tools, libraries , frameworks, front end testing , node js , meteor and many more. As we know JS is the future so why not learn about it. We hope to have interactive, fun and educational meetups.

name: Geek2Geek - Berlin Tech Talk
description:
Geek2Geek is a monthly Berlin Tech Talk. Our goal is to bring software developers with a diverse background together. We noticed that the coding community is often isolated, meaning that PHP devs. are only going to PHP UG's and Java devs. solely to Java UG's

However, we believe that we could achieve great things if we connect. If you're a open source developer, start-up, techie, or geek using Java, Ruby, Python, Node.JS, PHP, JavaScript, R or Clojure, this group is for you!

Join us to be one step ahead and think outside the box. We're looking forward to meet you!

name: Girl Develop It Austin
description:
Want to learn how to code? Have a great idea? Don't be shy. Develop it! 

Girl Develop It is a national nonprofit organization dedicated to providing affordable and accessible technology classes for women in a judgement-free environment. 

Whether you want to advance your own knowledge of technology for your current job, or are looking to transition into a more tech-minded job, we're here to help get you the skills you need!

Courses we offer on a rotating basis:

• Intro to HTML / CSS

• Intro to Responsive Web Design

• Intro to HTML5 and CSS3

• Intro to Javascript

• Intro to Sass

• Intro to Web Servers with Node.JS

• Intro to the Command Line

• Intro to Git and Github

FAQ:

"I'm a guy. Can I come?"
Absolutely! We welcome anybody who wants to learn technology skills, all we ask is that you adhere to our Code of Conduct.

"Do you teach kids? / Can I bring my kids?"
Our organization is not equipped to teach anybody under the age of 18. As such, we do not offer kids classes. We cannot teach students under the age of 18, even with a guardian present. Check out the Girls Empowerment Network or ChickTech for curriculum for children.

"Why do you charge for your classes?"
Our instructors are all professionals at the top of their field, and we pay them for their time. Teaching a class, prepping material, slides, and resources is a time-consuming task. For those reasons, we pay our instructors and your class fee ensures our instructors are paid for their time.

"I don't see any upcoming classes"
That likely means we're taking a quick break between "course tracks." Subscribe to this meetup to be alerted when a new class is added.

"I have a hackathon / event that your members will really like. Can you help promote it?"
Unless we have first hand experience with your event and we are able to attest that your event will be friendly towards women or people just getting started in tech, we cannot promote your event.

organizer.name: Girl Develop It
organizer.bio: Girl Develop It is a nonprofit organization that exists to provide affordable and accessible programs to women who want to learn web and software development through mentorship and hands-on instruction.

next_event.name: Brunch and learn: building your brand and portfolio

name: CopenhagenJS
description:
Monthly meetup in Copenhagen for people interested in JavaScript. 

Everything JS is welcome: React, Node, Angular, Vue, Cycle, Ember, ES6, npm, Meteor, NodeBots, and maybe even frameworks and tools nobody has heard of yet.

name: Hyperledger London
description:
Does The Hyperledger Project have the potential to become the engine behind most successful decentralized applications and organizations created in the next 25-50 years? Absolutely!

A much better question is how, and in what new ways, can we:

a) Build decentralized applications, organizations and APIs at 10x the speed at 1/10 the cost.

b) Build situational awareness in the local community.

I believe that the convergence of decentralized applications, decentralized organizations, artificial intelligence and IoT brings upon us the Great Displacement of the 21st century, where the majority of workforce will be left without “conventional” jobs, forced to learn new skills and professions.

Why?

Founders of this group believe that the Hyperledger Foundation will be the engine behind decentralization of the world, a massive economic change of the next 25-50 years.

So.... why don't we standardize and democratize the field with and around Hyperledger?

What?

We are a local micro community of those interested in advancing their knowledge of Hyperledger, its use cases and applications.

How?

Join our group for a regular dose of human interaction, conversations, smiles, food and drinks on all things Hyperledger:

• Use Cases

• Competitive analysis of Hyperledger startups (Distributed Apps from disruptive companies in specific vertical markets)

• How-To’s

• Interviews with individuals working at the edge of the Hyperledger project

• Reviews of tools, services and APIs offered by the Hyperledger ecosystem

• Best Practices in Application Architecture

• Do’s and Don’ts

• Application Templates

• Hackathons

• Security in the decentralized world - on the edge, on the node, in the cloud and in transit

• How others solve some of the hard problems that exist in the world using Hyperledger.


Join the movement. Let’s change the world. Because with Hyperledger we can.

https://www.hyperledger.org/

https://github.com/hyperledger

next_event.name: Successful pilot projects, lessons learned and what lies ahead

name: js-montreal - montreal's javascript user group
description:
New: Help us make the group better by filling up our Yearly Survey

Want to learn more about JavaScript? Meet other people who are passionate about writing software? Show off your latest project?

We meet on every second tuesday of the month. The details are always available on js-montreal.org

Front-end, backend with Node and other tools, other interesting uses for JavaScript: We got you covered.

If you wish to sponsor one of our events, get in touch. We often do beer + pizza before the meetup and give you a chance to talk about your company and what you're looking for in terms of developers.

Our goal is to bring the MTL JS development community together and promote the use and understanding of the language, inside and outside the browser. We've been doing this since 2010.

name: Girl Develop It San Francisco
description:
Want to learn how to code? Have a great idea? Don't be shy, Develop it!

Girl Develop It is a non-profit teaching women how to code since 2010. We host a wide range of technical classes and workshops including beginner classes (Web Development, Beginner HTML/CSS, Javascript101) and advanced topics (AngularJS, Node, D3). We also organize professional events such as Meet the Company, Salary Negotiation, and Resume Building.

Join Us! We can't wait to see what you build.

name: Kubernetes Atlanta Meetup
description: Meet other developers and users of Kubernetes. Kubernetes is an open source orchestration system for Docker containers. It handles scheduling onto nodes in a compute cluster and actively manages workloads to ensure that their state matches the users declared intentions. Kubernetes can run almost anywhere, including Google Compute Engine, Vagrant, CoreOS, Azure, vSphere, RackSpace, etc. Learn more about Kubernetes at http://kubernetes.io
